page.title: 12Arlington Reservoir: ecology
page.content: The Reservoir is stocked annually with Rainbow Trout. Anglers buy season tickets to fish from April to October, catching a maximum of 2 brace a day. Other fish spawn has entered the reservoir and now breeds naturally. Coarse fish - roach, bream and perch - are not wanted in the reservoir and are fished out regularly and put back in the Cuckmere River. During 1985 the fish have been severely affected by the Ergasilus parasite. Slow-growing trees have been planted on parts of the bank. These are not yet well established and look like rough scrubland.
